title: Man finds 'maggot' in rasher of bacon - only for hotel bosses to tell him it's 'extra crispy fat'
text:

A hotel guest claims he found a maggot in a rasher of bacon only for bosses to say it was actual a piece of fat that made it 'extra crispy' 
The row happened at the Mercure Liverpool Atlantic Tower Hotel, on Chapel Street in the city where Tom Harris booked a nights stay with his girlfriend on January 28. 
The couple went for breakfast in the hotel’s restaurant and used the self service buffet facility, report the Liverpool Echo. 
However half way through tucking in to his meal Tom found what he believed to be a maggot in a rasher of bacon. 
He claims a waitress took the plate away, but made no apology and instead said that the ‘maggot’ was actually fat that they had made extra crispy. Read More 
The 27-year-old area sales manager, said he is disgusted at how the restaurant has treated him and claims the waitress even laughed about the situation. Tom Harris and his girlfriend found the 'maggot' (Photo: Liverpool Echo) 
He said: “I just can’t believe how blasé they have been about it. 
“The waitress just took my plate, came back about 15 minutes later and just started cleaning a table next to us and was laughing. 
“It was just disgusting and then to insult my intelligence by telling me it was crispy bacon.” Read More Tom said since the incident he has rang and emailed the hotel, which has a four star rating, and was offered a free nights stay or his money refunded for the £100 room. Mercure Liverpool Atlantic Tower Hotel, Chapel Street (Photo: Google) 
He said: “It has just snowballed to be honest. 
“It could have been a complaint that was just dealt with there and then but it has taken me nearly two weeks to get an apology. 
“It is their customer service that has annoyed me more, obviously finding that in my food was awful but I was just so annoyed by how it was handled.” 
Jonathen Marsden, operations manager for Mercure Liverpool Atlantic Tower Hotel, said the ‘maggot’ “looks like it is some fat on the rind of the bacon”. 
He added: “We have done a thorough investigation as we do with any guest feedback, what ever it might be. 
“We have strict hygiene guidelines both from the company and the local council, who make regular inspections which we have recently passed with flying colours.” Like us on Facebook
